H0.text: Water flowing in a riverbed is the event that causes the fastest change to Earth's surface for Penny's class, who were learning how rapidly some changes can happen on Earth.

H1.text: A wave crashing on a beach is the event that causes the fastest change to the surface of Earth, as Penny's class studied how rapidly some changes can happen on Earth.

H2.text: An earthquake cracking a road is the event that causes the fastest change to the surface of Earth, as Penny's class learns about how rapidly some changes can happen on Earth.

H3.text: Wind blowing against a mountain is the event that causes the fastest change to the surface of Earth, as Penny's class was studying rapid geological changes.

A4.text: Ground rupture is a visible breaking and displacement of the Earth's surface along the trace of the fault, which may be of the order of several meters in the case of major earthquakes.
